titleproper.value:
Guide to the Leonard Sloan Torgoff Papers
                    <num>ALBA.109</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Wendy Scheir

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-28T16:36-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Leonard Sloan Torgoff (1916-1937) went to Spain in January 1937 to join the International Brigades in the Spanish Civil War. The following month he was killed when his truck was ambushed during the Battle of Jarama. This collection contains correspondence and other materials dating from Torgoff's high school and college years, including examples of Torgoff's published and unpublished writings.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Torgoff went by the nickname Leo or Leon; Sloan was his mother's maiden name.

S 
                <emph render="bold">eries II: Writings, 1932-1936</emph>. This series contains examples of Torgoff's published and unpublished writings, and includes essays, poetry, short stories, and notes. Also included are Torgoff's "Moods and Muses" columns, written while attending the University of Denver; and a number of papers written for school.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejército Popular de la República. Brigada Internacional, XV--Biography.
